page.title: 10Shopping
page.content: The shopping facilities in Kirkcaldy and Levenmouth have a considerable influence on the shopping patterns of people in East Wemyss and Buckhaven. This influence is reflected in the significant number of boarded up shop fronts, particularly in East Wemyss. The shops which do exist sell mainly convenience goods which are needed on a daily basis. The majority of the villager travel to either Kirkcaldy or Leven for their main weekly shopping and for non-durable goods. There is at least one bus every half hour to Kirkcaldy or Leven so access is no problem to the considerable number of people without a car. Rising transport costs will help to maintain the importance of local shops selling conveince goods.
